I do not think this attack is sound. It does create tricky complications, and in an over-the-board situation, especially in a blitz-type game, it could be a useful line to try. If Black doesn't have time to think, a blunder could emerge.
Forced.
I think White was counting on this move winning the Knight on my Q4.
My opponent may have overlooked that this response saves the piece.
Applying more pressure...
...and I guard the Knight again. White can't drive away the guard with 10 P-QR3?? because 0f 10...NxP ch!, winning a Rook.
This stops the Knight fork.
However, with the Pawn now guarding the pinned Knight, I can lose at most a Pawn in the ensuing exchanges, if my opponent forces the issue.
